results.title: The Umbrellas of Cherbourg = Les Parapluies de Cherbourg
results.creator_credit: Madeleine Films, Mag Bodard and Jacques Demy
results.brief_description: With a luscious musical score by Michel Legrand, “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg” is a lyrical fantasy about the nature of true love. Featuring astonishing colour cinematography and directed by Demy to resemble a fairy-tale, the story is about a young shop-girl (Catherine Deneuve) who falls in love with a working-class mechanic played by Nino Castelnuovo. Their romance ends when he is drafted into the Algerian War and she is left pregnant and alone. She marries the honourable merchant, Cassard (Marc Michel), but when she meets her first love years later, she has to choose between the safety of marriage and the passion and magic of her true love. Featuring glorious sets and art design, this musical has been honoured as one of the greatest of all movie musicals, winning the Palme d’Or in Cannes in 1964. The ravishing Deneuve has never been more beautiful and Castelnuovo is the epitome of Latin good looks - together they are one of the screen’s loveliest couples. This version of the film is based on the 1992 restoration by the French Ministry of Culture which faithfully restores the intense colour of the original.

results.title: The Umbrella Woman
results.creator_credit: Laughing Kookaburra Productions, Michael Nolin, Jan Sharp and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: An innocent passion for a forbidden experience leads Daisy (Rachel Ward) into a three-sided relationship with her forgiving husband (Bryan Brown) and her husband’s brother. When small town prejudice threatens to overturn all their lives Daisy’s sexual pursuit becomes even more of an obsession as she turns her attention to the newly arrived womanising barman (Sam Neill) - with almost tragic consequences.

results.title: The Umbrella man
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Ben Park and Ronald Fleher
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the establishment of an umbrella factory run entirely by disabled persons in Addis Ababa. Today, the self-supporting disabled, acquire in this pilot factory, a sense of their own usefulness and dignity. Moreover the factory saves Ethiopia valuable foreign exchange.

results.title: The Ultimate Thrill Skydiving
results.brief_description: Experience the ultimate thrill of skydiving in this incredible video that gives you an inside look at this unique sport. View all aspects of skydiving from preparation, jumping and freefall, to stunts and landings with detailed photography that allows you to see all the action. Filmed from a skydiver’s perspective, experience the panoramic views only possible through this sport. In addition to giving you an educational and interesting look at this remarkable sport, you will also be entertained by the fast-paced action.

results.title: The Ultimate mystery
results.creator_credit: Hartley Productions, Irving Hartley, Elda Hartley and Harvey F. Bellin
results.brief_description: Describes a variety of parapsychological phenomena, focusing on experiments with plants and bacteria and investigations of the work of faith healers and acupuncturists.

results.title: The Ultimate Frank Lloyd Wright (PC)
results.creator_credit: Microsoft Corporation, Byron Preiss and Jeff Hixson
results.brief_description: A stimulating history of Wright’s influential architectural design which gives you insight to his genius as well as an understanding of the influence his architecture has had on subsequant generations of architects. This program allows you to design your own buildings and gain an understanding of the architectural process. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or comp- atible with a 486/33 microprocessor; 4 MB of RAM (8 MB recommended); 500 KB of avaialable hard-disk space; double speed CD-Rom drive; super VGA display; MS DOS operating system (version 3.1 or later); Microsoft Windows version 3.1 or later; MPC-compatible sound card; Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device.

results.title: The Ultimate Frank Lloyd Wright (MAC)

The program allows you to design your own buildings and gain an understanding of the architectural process. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Any Macintosh computer that supports a 256 colour, 640 x 480 or higher resolution monitor; System 7 or later; 2MB available hard-disk space.

results.title: The Ugly Duckling (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Walt Disney introduces Danish story teller, Hans Christian Anderson, and presents an animated illustration of the writer’s life, from his humble beginnings as the son of a shoemaker and washer-woman, to his rise to international fame as a writer. This program also includes the well-known story of the Ugly Duckling.

This program also includes the well-known story of the Ugly Duckling.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. The well-known Hans Christian Anderson fairy tale of the ugly baby duck that turned out to be a beautiful swan when it grew up is retold with live animals. Filmed in Europe, real ducks, chickens, geese and swans are pictured against authentic background settings.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company, Masaji Hara, Matsue Jimbo, Shigeki Ishikawa, Kazuhiko Watanabe and H.C. Andersen
results.brief_description: Using toy like models of animals and birds, this film tells Hans Christian Anderson’s story of the hardships undergone by an ugly duckling until he finds himself a beautiful swan.
